content: P 2 W 18 Co 4 @MOF-545-EP was prepared in two steps to avoid exposing the POM to high voltage. To form MOF-545-EP, two ITO electrodes were immersed 3 mm apart in a colloidal suspension containing 1 mg of MOF-545 in 4 mL of toluene. A 45 V cell voltage was then applied between the two electrodes for 30 min three times consecutively and with no agitation, the MOF suspension being renewed between each cycle. P 2 W 18 Co 4 @MOF-545-EP was then obtained by immersing the MOF-545-EP electrodes in a 5 mM solution of P 2 W 18 Co 4 in an 80 mM B­(OH)3 pH 8 buffer solution for 5 h. The EP thin films were carefully washed with water to allow the release of POMs adsorbed at the surface of MOF particles. P 2 W 18 Co 4 @MOF-545-DC was drop casted (10 μL) from a suspension of 1 mg of P 2 W 18 Co 4 @MOF-545 in 1 mL of ethanol on an ITO electrode of area 36 mm2 and allowed to dry at room temperature for 10 min. For P 2 W 18 Co 4 @MOF-545-DC, the material mass was calculated at 0.01 mg according to the concentration and volume of the deposited drop. For P 2 W 18 Co 4 @MOF-545-EP, the mass of deposited material was measured by weighting the material over 20 electrodes prepared in identical conditions, leading to an average deposited MOF amount of 0.11 mg. Using the chemical formula ([Zr6O18H18]3[C48H26O8N4]6 [P2W18O70Co4H4]0.6·78H2O) determined for the P2W18Co4@MOF-545 powder, P 2 W 18 Co 4 @MOF-545-DC contains 0.53 nmol and P 2 W 18 Co 4 @MOF-545-EP 5.8 nmol of P2W18Co4 , equivalent to 1.5 and 16 nmol cm–2 of POM, respectively.
clean_text:
Thin Films' Preparation

 P  2  W  18  Co  4  @MOF-545-EP was prepared in two steps to avoid exposing the POM to high voltage. To form MOF-545-EP, two ITO electrodes were immersed 3 mm apart in a colloidal suspension containing 1 mg of MOF-545 in 4 mL of toluene. A 45 V cell voltage was then applied between the two electrodes for 30 min three times consecutively and with no agitation, the MOF suspension being renewed between each cycle. P  2  W  18  Co  4  @MOF-545-EP was then obtained by immersing the MOF-545-EP electrodes in a 5 mM solution of P  2  W  18  Co  4  in an 80 mM B(OH)3 pH 8 buffer solution for 5 h. The EP thin films were carefully washed with water to allow the release of POMs adsorbed at the surface of MOF particles. P  2  W  18  Co  4  @MOF-545-DC was drop casted (10 μL) from a suspension of 1 mg of P  2  W  18  Co  4  @MOF-545 in 1 mL of ethanol on an ITO electrode of area 36 mm2 and allowed to dry at room temperature for 10 min. For P  2  W  18  Co  4  @MOF-545-DC, the material mass was calculated at 0.01 mg according to the concentration and volume of the deposited drop. For P  2  W  18  Co  4  @MOF-545-EP, the mass of deposited material was measured by weighting the material over 20 electrodes prepared in identical conditions, leading to an average deposited MOF amount of 0.11 mg. Using the chemical formula ([Zr6O18H18]3[C48H26O8N4]6 [P2W18O70Co4H4]0.6⋅78H2O) determined for the P2W18Co4@MOF-545 powder, P  2  W  18  Co  4  @MOF-545-DC contains 0.53 nmol and P  2  W  18  Co  4  @MOF-545-EP 5.8 nmol of P2W18Co4 , equivalent to 1.5 and 16 nmol cm-2 of POM, respectively.
